<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tinkering Fingers](/Feats.aspx?ID=1300) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Ratfolk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=234" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 22 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You're good with your hands and can quickly improvise a fix for broken or damaged equipment. You're trained in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4). If you would automatically become trained in Crafting (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You can [Repair](/Actions.aspx?ID=42) an item without using a [repair kit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=43) without taking the –2 circumstance penalty, improvising tools from whatever you have at hand.
name: Tinkering Fingers
